body:
## Expected Behavior
I should be able to create a `Datetime` search attribute in SQLite and set it with either `2001-01-01T00:00:00.0000000-06:00` or `2001-01-01T00:00:00.0000000+00:00` (both of these pass `time.Parse(time.RFC3339Nano, ...` which docs say is what is required)

## Actual Behavior
I can persist `2001-01-01T00:00:00.0000000-06:00`, but trying `2001-01-01T00:00:00.0000000+00:00` I get:

> invalid value for search attribute SomeDateTimeAttribute of type Datetime: 2001-01-01T00:00:00.0000000+00:00

Replicated on Temporalite 0.3.0 which is server 1.18.1.

comments.body: I owe a replication on this. @rodrigozhou wasn't able to replicate so it may be something wrong on my side.

title: Search attribute persistence with SQLite using Datetime fails with +0 timezone
